page.title: 06Pembroke Dockyard Part 1
page.content: During the Napoleonic wars more ships were needed,further land was not available at Milford Haven so this site,then known as Paterchurch was chosen as the Royal Dockyard.It grew in size for 40 years until it was the largest and one of the finest shipbuilding yards in the world,employing more than 4000 people.Unfortunately when steel ships became popular at the turn of the century the dockyard failed to convert successfully to building them and this together with the fall in demand and it's geographical position began it's eventual rundown.In 1914 war broke out and sparked a revival in the dockyard's fortunes,but this was short lived and from 1918 on it really began to die until in 1923 it was closed completely.In 1932 the R.A.F.took over part and by 1939 it was the largest
